title.value: Seeds – a source of tomato diseases causal agents

journal.title: Agriculture and Plant Protection : scientific-practical journal

person.name: Tolopilo, A.N,, National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Arable Farming (Belarus). Institute of Plant Protection

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus there were presented results of phytopathological analysis of the commercial tomato (Lycopersicon esculentum) hybrid seeds cultivated under greenhouse conditions of the republic. There was the infection of the studied seeds with fungal (Ascochyta lycopersici, Fusarium sp., Alternaria solani) and viral diseases (Tomato aspermy virus, Pepino mosaic virus) carrying a potential danger to the tomato plants development. Thus, the phytopathologic examination of commercial seed tomato hybrids grown in protected soil showed their high infection (up 21.4 %) with the pathogens of fungal diseases (Ascochyta sp., Fusarium sp., Alternaria sp.). Carriers of the virus aspermia tomato (BAT) are hybrids of tomato seeds Gayana, Bomaks, Geronimo, Torero and Alcazar, where was marked the highest concentration of registered virus (0,375 units. optical density). Pepino mosaic virus is found in the seeds of tomato F1Torero and F1 Geronimo. Infected tomato seeds are a source of fungal and viral spread of infection that should be considered in the development of protective measures.
